Class Pawn

java.lang.Object
pieces.Piece
pieces.Pawn
public class Pawn extends Piece
Represents a Pawn piece in chess. Pawns move forward one square, or two squares on their first move. They capture diagonally forward.

  • Field Summary

    Fields inherited from class pieces.Piece

    col, color, row

  • Constructor Details

    • Pawn

      public Pawn(String color, int row, int col)
      Constructs a new Pawn with the specified color and position.
      Parameters:
      color - The color of the pawn ("white" or "black").
      row - The initial row position (0-7).
      col - The initial column position (0-7).

  • Method Details

    • possibleMoves

      public List<int[]> possibleMoves(Piece[][] board)
      Calculates all possible moves for this pawn from its current position. Includes forward moves and diagonal captures.
      Specified by:
      possibleMoves in class Piece
      Parameters:
      board - The current board state.
      Returns:
      A list of possible moves, where each move is represented as [row, col].

    • setPosition

      public void setPosition(int row, int col)
      Sets the position of this pawn and marks it as having moved.
      Overrides:
      setPosition in class Piece
      Parameters:
      row - The new row position (0-7).
      col - The new column position (0-7).

    • hasMoved

      public boolean hasMoved()
      Checks if this pawn has moved from its starting position.
      Returns:
      true if the pawn has moved, false otherwise.

    • canPromote

      public boolean canPromote()
      Checks if this pawn can be promoted (reached the opposite end of the board).
      Returns:
      true if the pawn can be promoted, false otherwise.
